intro: Paraboea alternifolia, commonly known as the alternate-leaf paraboea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial with alternate, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for botanical gardens and tropical landscapes.
